meanings.definition: The internal organs of a human or animal.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the innards of the patient to determine the cause of the pain.
meanings.sent2: The hunter carefully removed the innards of the deer after the successful hunt.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the secret to a delicious stew was in the innards of the recipe.
meanings.sent4: As the archaeologist uncovered the mummy, the innards of ancient civilizations were revealed.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie scene showed the monster tearing out the innards of its victim.

meanings.definition: The internal parts or workings of something.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic opened the hood of the car to inspect the innards of the engine.
meanings.sent2: The computer technician carefully cleaned the innards of the laptop to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: The curious child tried to peek inside the clock to see the innards ticking away.
meanings.sent4: The innards of the old clock were so intricate, they resembled a miniature city.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the innards of a machine is crucial for its proper maintenance.
